meanings.definition: To seize control of (a vehicle) by force
meanings.sent1: The criminals hijacked the bus and demanded money from the passengers.
meanings.sent2: The pirates hijacked the ship and took the crew hostage.
meanings.sent3: The squirrels hijacked the bird feeder, leaving the birds without food.
meanings.sent4: The virus hijacked the computer system, causing chaos in the office.
meanings.sent5: The storm hijacked the picnic, forcing everyone to seek shelter.

meanings.definition: To take control of (something) without permission
meanings.sent1: The hackers hijacked the website and posted inappropriate content.
meanings.sent2: The thief hijacked the purse from the unsuspecting pedestrian.
meanings.sent3: The cat hijacked the dog's bed, claiming it as her own.
meanings.sent4: The weeds hijacked the garden, choking out the flowers.
meanings.sent5: The toddler hijacked the remote control, changing the channels randomly.
